buildup.text: A bubble forms when asset prices far exceed their fundamental value, driven by speculation.

discovery.text: The tricky part: you can never prove it's a bubble until it pops. Before that, it's just 'growth.'

twist.text: Economist Charles Kindleberger found that every bubble shares the same five stages across centuries.
